main_definition: A panel can refer to a flat or rectangular surface, a group of experts discussing a topic, an electrical component in electronics, or a construction element made up of several connected parts.

meanings_and_examples.example: The wooden panel on the wall was scratched and needed to be replaced.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A group of experts discussing a topic
meanings_and_examples.example: The committee held an open panel discussion with various industry leaders about climate change.
The circuit board had several panels for different voltage levels.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A construction element made up of several connected parts
meanings_and_examples.example: The house's roof was composed of individual wooden panels that were nailed together to form the structure.
